description_text:
Hello,

I have the Simsonn Pro X Ultra pedals I bought a couple of months ago and
I'm having a few issues.

First and most importantly I'm having an issue where the pedals in the
manager are calibrated, however in any game the pedal input does not
register anything until it reaches 50% travel. I have tried to delete and
redownload the software and I've updated both the manager and control box
as well and it still is giving me an issue and I am unable to use them
effectively.

The second issue is I have a VAM Pro motor on the brake pedal and it does
not do anything outside of the manager test. It will not react to any ABS
event in any game I've tried.

Thank you for your time
Chris

conversations.body_text: Hi Chris Bauer,    First, please update the software to SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 and check for pedal firmware updates in the settings menu. Once the update is complete, you can use the Offset function to reset the offset to zero, which will automatically adjust the dead zone to the minimum edge based on the current pedal pressure.  Second, make sure the software is up to date and review our telemetry support list. If the telemetry you need is not listed, you can use SIMHUB 9.9.3, which supports over 100 telemetry features.

I have done all the steps you listed and the issue is still present

On Sat, Jul 26, 2025, 10:30 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Chris Bauer,    You mentioned two different issues. Please provide screenshots or record a video for our analysis.  Kindly upload the video to Google Drive and share the link with us.

I have a video of the main issue in Lemans Ultimate. It does not register
any input until 50% for both the throttle and the brake. In the Simsonn
manager it shows full range of 0%-100%.


https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ah-CQp3eaR-XPX7Jwa3s-k0_UV3Iqe8A/view?usp=drive_link

On Sat, Jul 26, 2025 at 11:17 PM service@simsonn.com

I have not been able to prove it but I think that this is an issue with the
control box itself. The issues were pretty non existent until I got a VAM
Pro installed and hooked it up. Since this time it has seemed to gone
haywire and the controls and inputs for the pedals are hit or miss. I have
not once been able to get the VAM Pro to work on any sim with the most
updated version of SIMHUB. The pedals and the motor just have a mind of
their own at this point. Again I had almost no issues until I hooked up the
VAM Pro and the power supply. Now it appears as if there is no going back
as it happens whether the motor and power supply are hooked up or not. The
control box is mounted to my pedal plate and has been since I got the
pedals. It has gotten so bad i think it might be backfeeding power to my
motherboard as I'm now having intermittent issues with my keyboard, mouse
and streamdeck all constantly connecting and disconnecting making my
entire PC unusable. I have them completely unhooked just so i can do
anything else on my PC and this is very frustrating to the point where i
want to get rid of them and go with another company.

On Sun, Jul 27, 2025 at 9:52 AM Chris Bauer <chris.bauer0513@gmail.com>
wrote:

> I have a video of the main issue in Lemans Ultimate. It does not register
> any input until 50% for both the throttle and the brake. In the Simsonn

>
> On Sat, Jul 26, 2025 at 11:17 PM service@simsonn.com

What else can I do here? I would not have started this if I wasn't already
out of ideas.

Hi Chris Bauer,  Would you mind sharing how you ultimately resolved this issue? We’d like to include it in our knowledge base to help other customers facing similar problems. Thank you for your support!
